subject: News Summary
body:
CBSNews.com






June 29, 2007

TOP STORIESCops Defuse Central London Car Bomb
London police have defused a "potentially viable explosive device" in a car in the central theater district. Officials say
                        propane canisters and nuts and bolts were found in car, and the device would have caused significant damage if it had exploded. More...Watch: Expert On British Bomb Scare
• Debate Showcases Clinton, Obama Rivalry• 5 U.S. Soldiers Killed In Iraq Attack
                     					| Watch• Eerie Twist In Wrestler's Murder-Suicide
                     					| WatchU.S.No Relief For Rain-Weary Texas
Flood-weary residents hoping for a reprieve from the sustained, heavy rains that have soaked parts of Texas may have to wait,
                        as forecasts called for more of the same. Eleven deaths have been blamed on the storms in north and central Texas. More...Watch: Flash Floods Strike Texas
• Eerie Twist In Wrestler's Murder-Suicide
                     					| Watch• Mentally Ill Killer's Execution Blocked• Town Mourns Cheerleaders Killed In Crash• More StoriesWorld5 U.S. Soldiers Killed In Iraq Attack
Five American soldiers were killed and seven wounded in a coordinated attack in southern Baghdad involving a roadside bomb
                        and rocket-propelled grenades, the U.S. military announced. The soldiers were on a combat patrol in at the time of the attack. More...Watch: Informants Help Troops In Iraq
• Castro: God Protected Me From Bush• Cops Defuse Central London Car Bomb
                     					| Watch• Ireland Elects Its First Black Mayor• More StoriesPoliticsDebate Showcases Clinton, Obama Rivalry
In a debate held in an atmosphere friendly to Democrats, the spotlight shined on the intense battle between Hillary Clinton,
                        who wants the support her husband enjoyed among blacks, and Barack Obama, the most viable black candidate in U.S. history. More...
• Dems Decry Desegregation Ruling In Debate• Bush Rejects Subpoenas From Congress
                     					| Watch• Castro: God Protected Me From Bush• More StoriesHealthHow To Cut Midlife Heart Disease
Middle age isn't too late to cut heart disease if you adopt a healthy lifestyle, say experts. More...
• U.S. To Stop Some Chinese Seafood Imports
                     					| Watch• Lupus Drug May Cause Male Infertility• Bush Believes Americans Need More Exercise
                     					| Watch• More StoriesSciTechAmazing Gene Swap Creates Microbe Makeover
For years, scientists have moved single genes and even large chunks of DNA from one species to another. Now scientists have
                        transplanted an entire genome, all of an organism's genes, from one bacterium into another in one fell swoop. More...
• House Nixes Auto Industry Mileage Plan• China Is Tops In Greenhouse Gas Emissions
                     					| Watch• Evidence Of Farming In Ancient S. America• More StoriesBusinessFed Leaves Key Interest Rate Unchanged 
The Federal Reserve left a key interest rate unchanged, expressing new optimism on economic growth and lower inflation. Analysts
                        believe that Fed officials could keep rates as is through the rest of this year and well into 2008. More...
• Honda Tops In Customer Satisfaction Survey• Newspapers Not Quite Dead Yet• How To Avoid Summer Travel Snafus• More StoriesEntertainmentStreisand Awarded Legion Of Honor Medal
"You are the America that we love," said French President Nicolas Sarkozy, as he presented Barbra Streisand with the Legion
                        of Honor medal.  "Women like you ... do a lot to bring our two peoples together." More...
• Spector Prosecutor Grills Defense Expert• Washington: Racism Caused My Firing
                     					| Watch• Eve Pleads No Contest To DUI Case• More StoriesOpinionRightward Ho!
Legal analyst Andrew Cohen says that two things are responsible for the Supreme Court's marked turn to the right: math
                        and art. More...
• Life Potatoes• Iraq's Key: Strength From Within

                     					| Watch• More StoriesCBS NEWS BROADCASTSThe Early Show: Recipes: Summer Drinks In Big Batches
Bon Appetit magazine's Andrew Knowlton shared easy recipes for making them a pitcher at a time, without sacrificing taste,
                        on The Early Show. More...

Lone Star Storms & FloodingAs more rain fell over Texas, cresting rivers began to overflow. There renewed fears about more floods, evacuations and rescue
                                    operations. Hari Sreenivasan reports.
